Content: and actually instead of using 10000, use komodo_pricemult(ind)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the komodo_pricemult() is what to multiply the 32bit price to an 8 decimals satoshis based number

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for BTC/USD it only has 4 decimals precision, so it is multiplied by 10000

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for crypto prices it is already at 8 decimals precision, so multiplied by 1

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for forex currencies it is in 2 decimals, so multiplied by 1000000

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: by reversing this scaling, it should always end up with something that fits in a uint32_t and that wont ever overflow

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think around 4000.0000 it overflows the 64 bits when multiplied by 100 mil

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: by dividing by 10000 we should be good for at least a few years before BTC price overflow
